column2: Oh Monica that was the best Thanksgiving dinner ever! I think you\nkilled us.'
I couldn't possibly eat another bite. "
I need something sweet.'
Does anyone wanna watch TV?'
Yeah, sure.'
Monica your remote doesn't work."
Phoebe, you have to lift it and point.'
Oh. Aw, forget it.'
Yeah, you know what we should all do? We should play that game where\neveryone says one thing that they're thankful for."
Ooh-ooh, I! I am thankful for this beautiful fall we've been having."
That's very nice."
That's sweet, Joey."
Yeah, the other day I was at the bus-stop and this lovely fall breeze came\nin out of nowhere and blew this chick's skirt right up. Oh! Which reminds me, I'm also\nthankful for thongs. (Note

I mean, it's not so much an underpant as it is a feat of engineering. I\nmean, it's amazing how much they can do with so little material! And the way they play\nwith your mind! Is it there? Is it not there?"
Are you aware that you're still talking?"
Is anyone thankful for anything else besides a thong?'
Huh, I don't know what to pick. Am I more thankful for my divorce or my\neviction? Hmm."
Wow! See, and I didn't think you'd be able to come up with anything."
I'm sorry. It's just that this is the worse Thanksgiving ever."
No-no-no! I am the king of bad Thanksgivings. You can't just\nswoop in here with your bad marriage and take that away from me."
Oh, you're not gonna tell the whole story about how your parents got\ndivorced again are you?"
Oh God, no.'
Oh, come on! I wanna hear it! It wouldn't be Thanksgiving without Chandler\nbumming us out!"
It's a tradition, like the parade. If the parade decided it was gay,\nmoved out, and abandoned its entire family."
Now Chandler dear, just because your father and I are getting a\ndivorce it doesn't mean we don't love you. It just means he would rather sleep with the\nhouse-boy than me."
More turkey Mr. Chandler? (And he makes eyes at him.)'
You're right. Yours is worse. You are the king of bad Thanksgivings."
I don't know about that. I've got one that's worse."
Really? Worse than, "More turkey Mr. Chandler?"'
Oh, did the little rich boy have a problem with the butler? Yes, mine's\nworse!"
In this life, Phoebe.'
Oh, this life! Oh okay no, Chandler's is worse."
Man, it must be so cool remembering stuff like that! I don't have any past\nlife memories."
Of course you don't sweetie. You're brand new."
I know Monica's worst Thanksgiving."
Oh, let's not tell this story."
Oh, come on!'
Oh no, I know! I know! It's the one where Joey got Monica's turkey stuck\non his head!"
What?! Joey got a turkey stuck on his head?!'
Hey, it's not like it sounds."
It's exactly like it sounds."
(muffled) Hello?'
(surprised) Hello?'
Phoebe?'
Joey? What's going on?"
Look. (He walks out of the bathroom with his head stuck in a huge turkey.)'
Oh my God!'
I know! It's stuck!!!"
(walks him to the kitchen) Easy. Step. How did it get on?'
I put it on to scare Chandler!'
Oh my God! Monica's gonna totally freak out!"
Well then help me get it off! Plus, it smells really bad in here.'
Well, of course it smells really bad. You have your head up a dead\nanimal.'
(entering) Hey!'
Hey!'
Hey, did you get the turkey basted\xc2\x97Oh my God! Oh my God! (She sees\nsomeone is stuck in the turkey.) Who is that?'
It's Joey."
What-what are you doing? Is this supposed to be funny?'
No, it's not supposed to be funny, it's supposed to be scary."
Well, get it off now!'
I can't! It-it's stuck!"
Well, I don't care! That-that turkey has to feed 20 people at my\nparent's house and they're not gonna eat it off your head!"
All right, hold on! Okay, let's just all think."
Okay, I got it. Phoebe? All right, you pull. I'm gonna spread the legs\nas wide as I can. (Joey starts giggling.) Joey? Now is not the time!"
Sorry! Sorry.'
Okay, count to three. 1. 2. 3!'
Arghhhhhh!! (Joey turns around to taunt him, but Chandler is in the\ndoorway and Joey is facing the kitchen.)'
(pointing) It worked! I scared ya, I knew it! Ha-ha!'
I'm over here big guy."
(turning all the way around, and still not facing Chandler) Yeah, you are!\n(Starts dancing.) I scared you!'
(laughing) You did look like an idiot.'
Hey, I wasn\'t the only one who looked like an idiot. All right? Remember\nwhen Ross tried to say, "Butternut squash?" And it came out, "Squatternut\nbuash?"'
Yeah that's the same."
That's it. That's my worse Thanksgiving."
Oh wait! That can't be the one Rachel's talking about. She didn't even\nknow that happened. So which one was it?"
Which one?'
Umm, I-I really don't want to tell this story."
Oh, come on Monica, reliving past pain and getting depressed is what\nThanksgiving is all about. Y'know, for me anyway. And of course, the Indians."
Look umm, of all people, you do not want me to tell this story!'
Monica! I think Rachel's here!"

I'll get it! (She runs in, and she's her old fat self like The One With\nThe Prom Video. Not only that, she's out of breath after running a short distance. She\ngoes over and opens the door to reveal Rachel with her old nose.) Happy Thanksgiving!"
Not for me. Chip and I broke up!'
Oh, why? Why? What happened?'
Well, you know that my parents are out of town and Chip was\ngoing to come over\xc2\x85'
Yeah, yeah, and you were going him y'know, your flower."

Okay, Monica, can you just call it sex?! It really
creeps me out when you call it that! Okay, and by the way, while we're at it, a guy's
thing is not called his tenderness. Believe me! (Walks into the living room and greets
Monica's parents.) Hi!"
Hi Rachel!'
Happy Thanksgiving!'
You too sweethart!'
(entering) Hey! '
Oh my!'
Uh, everyone, this is Chandler! My roommate and lead singer of our band!'
Ross! (Wanting to be introduced.)'
Oh, this is Monica.'
Hi, I'm Ross's little sister."
(seeing her) Okay.'
I'm so glad you could come Chandler, we've got plenty of food so I\nhope you're hungry."
Oh, mom. Mom. Chandler hates Thanksgiving and doesn't eat any Thanksgiving\nfood."
Oh, well, I'm so glad you brought him here then."
Umm, Chandler, if you want I can make you some macaroni and cheese\nfor dinner.'
Well, as long as the pilgrims didn't eat it, I'm in."
dammit! (Runs off.)'
So uh, Rach? Does it, does it feel weird around here now? Y'know since\nI've been away at college."
Oh! No, not really.'
Well, that's cool. So did\xc2\x85 (She walks away from him and he shuts up.)"
Ugh! I cannot believe Chip dumped me for that slut\nNancy Branson. I am never going out with him again. I don't care how much he begs!"
I think his begging days are over now that he's going out with Nancy\nBranson."
Y'know what? I've just had it with high school boys! They are\njust silly. (Ross is overhearing this.) Silly, stupid boys! I'm going to start dating men!"
Umm, I'm sorry Judy, I couldn't find that bowl that you and Jack were\nlooking for."
Call them mom and dad you loser!'
(in a high pitched voice) Monica!'
Hey Chandler! Did you like the macaroni and cheese?'
Oh yeah, it was great. You should be a chef.'
Okay!'
Guess what?! All that stuff about Nancy Branson being a slut\nwas all a rumor so Chip dumped her and he wants to come over to my house tonight!'
Oh that's so great!"
I know!'
Oh gosh, listen if you and Chip do it tonight, promise me you'll\ntell me everything."
Oh totally, totally. Y'know it's not that big of deal, we\nalready kinda did it once y'know."
I know, but y'know, this time you're gonna definitely know\nwhether or not you did it!"
I know, I know. And oh, and this time Chip promised\nthat-that this time it will last at least for an entire song!'
So I\xc2\x92m thinking about asking Rachel out tonight. Y'know maybe play\nher that song we wrote last week."
Emotional Knapsack?'
Yeah.'
Right on! Oh! Uh, but, don\xc2\x92t take to long okay? 'Cause uh, we're\ngonna test out our fake ID's tonight, right Clifford Alverez."
Listen, Roland Chang, if things go well, I\xc2\x92m gonna be out with her\nall night.'
Dude, don't do that too me!"
All right, it's cool you can stay here. My parents won't mind."
No, it's not that, I just don't want to be stuck here all night with\nyour fat sister."
Hey!'
(holding two pies) Monica, why don't you finish off these pies? I\ndon't have any more room left in the fridge."
No. No, thank you!'
Well Judy, you did it! She's finally full!"
I called you fat?! I don't even remember that!"
Well, I do.'
I am so sorry. I really am. I was an idiot back then. I rushed the\nstage at a Wham concert for crying out loud!'
Oh, I can't believe you called her fat."
I can't believe you let George Michael slap you."
I am really sorry. That is so terrible. I am so, so sorry.'
Actually, y'know that's not the Thanksgiving I was talking about."
Yes, it was!'
No, it wasn't. It was actually the\xc2\x85"
(interrupting her) Okay, now Thanksgiving's over, let's get ready for\nChristmas. Who wants to go get a Christmas tree?!"
Oh, no, I have the cutest Christmas story!'
We wanna hear Monica's Thanksgiving story!"
Fine, all right, mine had a dwarf that got broke in half, but y'know\nwhatever."
So Rachel, your mom tells me you changed your major again.'
Oh, yeah, I had too. There was never any parking by the Psychology\nbuilding.'
(entering) Hi Rachel.'
Oh hi!'
Wow, love your new nose!'
Jack.'
What? Dr. Wilson's an artist! He removed my mole cluster. Wanna see?\n(He starts to show her as the doorbell rings.)"
I'll get it."
No, God! Please, let me! (Runs out.)'
Hey!'
Hey. (To his parents) Happy Thanksgiving! '
(To Chandler) God, your hair sure is different!'
Yeah, we were just talking about that. I can't believe how stupid we\nused to look. (They both quickly push their sleeves over their elbows.)"
So uh, where's Monica?"
She's upstairs. Monica! Come down! Everyone's here! Ross, Rachel,\nand the boy who hates Thanksgiving."
Hi, Chandler.'
Oh my God!'
What-what's the matter? Is there, is there something on my dress? (She\nturns around making sure he gets a good look.)"
You just, you look so different! Terrific! That dress! That body!'
Dude!'
Sorry!'
Yes, yes Monica is thin. It's wonderful. But what we really want to\nhear about is Ross's new girlfriend."
Oh mom! Okay, umm, her name is Carol. And she's really pretty. And smart.\nAnd uh, she's-she's on the lacrosse team and the golf team. Can you believe it? She plays\nfor both teams!"
So Chandler, I guess I'll see you at dinner."
Dude!'
Sorry.'
(entering) Oh-ho, my God! That was so awesome! You totally got him back\nfor calling you fat! He was just drooling all over you. That must've felt so great!"
Well it didn't!"
What?!'

Yeah, I mean yeah, I look great. Yeah, I feel great and yeah, my heart
is not in trouble anymore! Blah, blah, blah! Y'know I still don't feel like I got him
back, y'know? I just want to humiliate him. I wanna, I want him to be like naked and then
I'm going to point at him and laugh!"
Okay, that we may be able to do.'
How?'
Well guys tend to get naked before they're gonna have sex."
What?! I mean, I didn't work this hard and-and-and lose all this weight\nso that I can give my flower to someone like him!"
Okay, first of all, if you keep calling it that, no one's gonna ever\ntake it. Then, second of all you're not actually gonna have sex with him! You're just\ngonna make him think that you are."
Yeah.'
Yeah.'
And when he's naked I can throw him out in the front yard and lock the\ndoor and all the neighbors will just humiliate him!"
Then, you will definitely get him back!'
Okay, so how do I make him think I wanna have sex with him?'
Okay, oh, here's what you do. Just act like everything around you turns\nyou on."
What do you mean?'

Well, like anything can be sexy. Like umm, oh-oh, like this dishtowel!
(She grabs it and starts rubbing it on her cheek.) Ooh, ooh, this feels sooo good against
my cheek! And-and if I feel a little hot, I can just dab myself with it. Or I can bring it
down to my side and bring it through my fingers while I talk to him.'
(excited) I can do that!'
Yeah? Okay! Good, good, because he's coming. He's coming. (To Chandler)\nHey, what's up? (She leaves and closes the door behind her.)"
Monica, I was wondering if you can make me some of that righteous mac\nand cheese like last year.'

Umm, I'd love too! (She goes over and picks up the box and decides to\nfollow Rachel's advice and holds the box up to her cheek.) Ooh, I love macaroni and\ncheese. I love-I love the way this box feels against my cheek."
Okay.'

Boy, I love carrots! Oh! (She picks up a bunch of them and holds them
between her fingers.) Sometimes I like to put them between my fingers like this and-and
hold them down here while I talk to you. (She is rubbing her hip with the carrots.) Umm,
and-and-and y'know if I get really hot umm, I-I like to pick up this knife (She picks up a
knife without putting the box down. She's holding the box between her cheek and shoulder)
and-and umm, I-I put the cold steal against umm, (Pause) my body. (She doesn't have any
exposed skin within reach of the knife, so while holding the carrots in one hand and the
box between her face and shoulder, she rubs the knife on her stomach.)"
Are you all right?'

Oh yeah, of course. I'm fine it's just that\xc2\x97(She drops the box and\nin a reflex action tries to catch it with her arm, the knife slips out and slowly flips\nthrough the air and comes point first down into Chandler's shoe.)"
What do we got here?'
Twenty year old has got a severed toe on his right foot.'
Can you please not do that feet first? You know where his injury is!\nSevered toe, you just said it!'
It says here that the knife went right through your shoe.'
Of course it did. They're made of wicker."
Did you bring the toe?'
Oh yes! I have it right here, on ice! (She takes a bag of ice out of her\npurse and hands it to the doctor.)'
(opening it) Don't worry son, we'll just attach it and\xc2\x97(Stops\nsuddenly.)"
What?! What is it?'
You brought a carrot.'
What?'
This isn't your toe, this is a small, very cold piece of carrot."
You brought a carrot?!'
Oh my God! There's a toe in my kitchen."
God, I'm sorry! I'll go back and get it!"
It's too late, all we can do now is sow up the wound."
Without my toe?! I need my toe!'
Wait, no-no-no, I can go really fast! Dad, give me the keys to your Porsche!'
Oh, I'm not falling for that one!"
That's why I lost my toe?! Because I called you fat?!"
I didn't mean to cut it off. It was an accident."
That's why for an entire year people called me Sir Limps-A-Lot?!"
I'm sorry! It wasn't your whole toe!"
Yeah, well, I miss the tip! It's the best part. It has the nail. (He\nstorms out.)"
Chandler! (Follows him out.)'
(To Joey) Sir Limps-A-Lot, I came up with that.'
You're a dork."
I can't believe this."
Chandler, I said I was sorry.'
Yeah, well, sorry doesn\xc2\x92t bring back the little piggy that cried\nall the way home! I hate this stupid day! And everything about it! I'll see you\nlater."
Oh wait, Chandler, come here is there anything I can do? Anything?'
Yeah, just leave me alone for a while. (He goes into his apartment.)'
Oh-oh, I\'m a duck! I go, "Quack, quack!" I\xc2\x92m happy all\nthe time!'
Nice try.'
Wait, wait, wait! (She puts a Shriner's hat on the turkey.)"
Look, Monica\xc2\x85'
Look! (She puts a big, yellow pair of sunglasses on the bird.)'
This is not going to work.'
I bet this will work! (She starts dancing and Chandler cracks up.)'
You are so great! I love you!'
What?'
Nothing! I said, I said "You\'re so great" and then I just, I\njust stopped talking!'
You said you loved me! I can't believe this!"
No I didn't!"
Yes, you did!'
No I didn't!"
You love me!'
No I don't! Stop it! Stop it! Stop it! Stop it!"
